result.execSummary:
The defendant Kole W McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 25 jobs per month and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any class B establishments.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The court denies expunction.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Defendant Kole W McGeshick in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Kole W McGeshick in custody.  Charles James Simono does not appear as he is tied up in another hearing, have permission to proceed without State. Called at 2:34 PM. Lynch - resolved - 405 days credit (stipulated), agreement is a time served sentence. McGeshick withholds comment. Court senences the defendant to the following: sentenced to time served for 405 days with 405 days credit, judgment for any unpaid fines, right to appeal, adjourned.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kole W McGeshick in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:05 AM. State - here for a change of plea. Court has plea questionnaire. Scholke - amend count #1 to 961.41(3g)(am) - plead G, also pleading G to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. State agrees and moves to amend count # to 961.41(3g)(am) - class I felony. Court amends count #1 to 961.41(3g)(am). State -- joint recommendation on part and free to argue - probation for 3 years with conditions of: #1 - $500 fine plus costs and surcharges, costs only on other counts, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns, or class B establishments, employment/school, 250 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by medical provider, reimburse FCDTF (Forest County Drug Task Force) $200.00, argues for 365 days in FC jail and defense to argue for 120 days in FC jail. Scholke and McGeshick agree. McGeshick pleads G to counts #1 as amended and G to counts #2 and#3 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court dismisses and reads in count #4. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation and requests 1 year in FC jail - asks for money owed to FCDTF to be paid within a short period of time upon release from incarceration. Sholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - requests 120 days in FC jail - asks for expungement under 973.015 - requests 60 days to report for stated reasons. State objects to allowing the defendant time to report and has no position on expungement. McGeshick makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1, #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #1 - fine of $500 plus costs and surcharges, $250.00 DNA surcharge and submit DNA sample, costs only on count #2 and #3, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school (25/month), 250 hours of community service total, take all meds as prescribed and only in the manner in whcih they are prescribed, $200.00 reimbursement to FCDTF - due within 60 days within release from incarceration, 9 months in FC jail on count #1 - huber allowed - report immediately, denies expungement, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, no possession of body armor, right to appeal.

Defendant Kole W McGeshick in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:40 PM. State - offer rejected and is withdrawn by State - need JT date. Scholke and McGeshick agrees, has advised defendant of the ramifications of rejecting a plea. Court continues bond, sets for 1 day JT. MIL will be heard on day of trial, parties aware that this is backing up another JT already scheduled, Court instructs to call witnesses at least 3 days prior to trial.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kole W McGeshick in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:20 PM. Scholke - not resolved for stated reasons - would prefer another FPT for stated reasons but leave the decision to the Court. Court continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kole W McGeshick in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:47 AM. Scholke has Information that mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Called at 2:56 PM. Kole McGeshick appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State calls Officer Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 2:57 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Burns. State objects - revelance - sustained (3:04 PM). State objects - overruled (3:04 PM). State objects - risk of law enforcement - overruled (3:04 PM). State objects - relevance - overruled (3:06 PM). Court questions witness. Robinson excused. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns has Information, set for ARGN. Court continues bond, set for ARGN on 1/21/15 at 9:00 AM.
